storyInfo: After returning from Davistown and submitting her mission report, Laura makes a decision about her future.

attributes.content: Laura? Fort Barron's nothing new to you, is it?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Oh... Sorry, I was just thinking about something...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I saw you staring at the model on the desk. You almost had me thinking maybe there was something wrong with it.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: I heard from the senior operators that the engineering team made this model as a memento, after Fort Barron's retrofit was completed and delivered.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: So, there's nothing wrong with it, right?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: It's fine. It looks... just like the base does now.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Good to hear. Shall we continue, then?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I'm ready. Let me take a look at your report... Ahem...
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Laura, what did you do after you received the order to catch the bank robbers?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: At the time, I was leading the engineering team to double-check the structural integrity of the plate connection, and after we got the news...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I chose to continue the work we were already doing.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Could you go into the reasoning behind your decision?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: The orders I received were that, aside from those participating directly in the plate's connection work, all other teams were to start pursuing the bank robbers.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: And I made the determination that the connection work still needed the manpower of our engineering team.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: So I chose to follow orders and not divert anyone from our work.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: But according to the report, one of the bank robbers was your partner at Davistown. Were you aware of that?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: I... I knew about that, yeah.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Regarding that, what was your determination at the time?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Determination... My determination?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: 'Don't make me repeat myself.'
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: My determination... I didn't make any...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I'm an employee of Blacksteel, and following my orders...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: ...is my responsibility.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: (Frowns) ......
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: 'Following orders. Laura, you made the right decision.'
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: How's that? I do a pretty good impression, right?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: And that 'Don't make me repeat myself' was, like, exactly the same, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: *sigh* What's wrong, Laura? You look so out of it. It can't be because I'm putting too much pressure on you, can it?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: It's okay... I'm just...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Please, let's just get back to it.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Um... That was the last question.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: I need to tell you this, Laura. Ever since we got back from Davistown, you've looked kind of uneasy.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: We all know that it was a very special operation, and you happened to be at the heart of the vortex.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: I really can't imagine what you went through, but even then, you can't let yourself be tied up by something like that.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: What you need now is rest.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Rest...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: And some very good rest. So stop thinking about the mission report. You should apply for leave instead.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: You're right... I can't stay so depressed.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: So Aliza, can we do this again, please?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: You haven't been listening at all, have you...?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: If you ask me, you'd best forget about the report.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: It's been two weeks. No one's ever going to bring it up again.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: In the long history of the company, this was only a tiny interlude. You can be as serious about this as you want, but the supervisor's only going to pretend to be interested.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: She's right. You should be asking them for a long vacation.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: No... I have to finish this report.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I was in Davistown from the start. I saw most of what happened with my own eyes. I experienced most of it personally.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: It's a Blacksteel employee's responsibility to execute their orders during a mission, and to compile a report on it afterwards. Besides...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: You saw what I wrote, didn't you? Don't you think the higher-ups should be informed of everything that happened in an organized report?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Laura, I...
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Frankly, there's no need to report anything. What happened in Davistown couldn't be any clearer.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: While completing a government-sanctioned mission, a Blacksteel employee participated in criminal activities and greatly damaged our company's image and reputation.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Everyone here already knows all that. It isn't something worth bringing up over and over again. Especially not... two weeks after the fact.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: We need paychecks to put food on the table. We need to follow orders and not get fired.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: So there's no reason for you to work yourself up over this.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: I... I still think I want to talk to somebody.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Where does it hurt?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Nothing wrong with that. That's how you learn discipline.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Are you going to do it again?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.text: I won't do it again, Mamá. I shouldn't have made a mess under the bed...
But... Mamá, I really love those machine parts. I know you don't like me playing with them, so I had to...

attributes.content: Sounds like you still don't realize what I'm punishing you for.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Follow me once you're done eating.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: What's the matter, Laura? You asked to talk to me all of a sudden.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Um, Franka, there's something I want your opinion on.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Is it about Davistown?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Is it that obvious?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Our little pistachio who's always cheering everyone up is suddenly acting all sulky. It'd be harder not to figure it out, don't you think?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I put together a report on Davistown.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Liskarm already submitted one.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Like, a good while ago?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I know, but—
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Alright, I can more or less guess what you wrote in there.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: And I can tell you what's going to happen if you submit it.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It'll be ignored, your issues won't be addressed, and if whoever has to read it is in a bad mood that day, you may even be disciplined.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It's that simple.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It's been two weeks, but sometimes I still think about what happened back there.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: All of us saw what was going on in Davistown. Jessica did so much for them, but even that wasn't enough for her.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Hasn't she always been like that though?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Franka... Do you think I did poorly in Davistown?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Wow, who knew pistachios were so rich in vitamin justice?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: This isn't about justice—
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: At least you two got to see her in the end. What was I doing while all that was going on...?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: She was in such a dangerous situation, but I was just hanging out on the ship.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Even though... Even though I really wanted to be with her...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: 'We're wearing Blacksteel uniforms and following the orders of the higher-ups. It's not your fault if you weren't able to do something.'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: If our good captain Liskarm were here, I'm sure she'd say that in the sincerest, most heartfelt way you ever heard.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Then, she'd probably give you a warm hug and make sure you knew you had someone to lean on aboard the landship.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Franka, are you—
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: All I'm saying is that if you turn around and go run into Liskarm's arms right about now, you'll get all the well-meaning advice and comfort you could ever want.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: But me? All you're gonna get from me is my sharp tongue and some finely aged sarcasm.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...I think that's what I want.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Alright then. Do you feel bad because you weren't able to help Jessica, or are you just jealous that she made a choice when you couldn't?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Did you write that report because you believe it's the truth, or are you just trying to convince yourself that you're not a coward?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I was born to a normal family. My mother is an ordinary doctor, but I didn't have a lot of freedom.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: My family moved from Bolívar to Columbia when I was younger. I managed to get into college, but then I caught Oripathy right before I graduated.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: None of the tech companies I was aiming for would give me a second glance. Blacksteel was the only place I could go.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: And when I got here, the first thing I learned was to follow orders and do whatever the rest of the team does.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I'm not jealous that she made a choice...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: The name Brynley gave Jessica more trouble than it ever helped. We could all see that.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: So I'm not jealous of her wealth either. I know she carries a much bigger burden than I do.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: But that's exactly why I don't get it. How come Jessica was able to make that choice?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: A silence falls between the two of them.
After some time, the brown-haired Vulpo looks up at the nightfall and breathes a sigh.
So, if you'd gone after Jessica with us after you got that order, would you have pointed your gun at her?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I wouldn't.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: What if you were ordered to?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I still wouldn't.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Because—
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I don't want to hurt her.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: So, don't you think you've already made a choice too?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: But, how's that—
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: How is it not?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: None of us are from a big, famous family like hers.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: When someone important makes a decision, it affects a lot of people, but for grunts like us, it doesn't have to matter to anyone but ourselves.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Is that really enough?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Why wouldn't it be?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Let's take a step back. Admitting that you just don't want to be a coward... would honestly be more honest than the truth.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: But isn't it important to tell the truth?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Sometimes, what's more important to the truth is being remembered.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I'm just gonna throw this out there, so you just listen.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: You know that place called Rhodes Island, where Liskarm and I are dispatched—
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The missions there are tough, but they offer some pretty nice benefits, and the people there are all pretty kind.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: If some little pistachio thinks there's no room in Blacksteel for her to grow...
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Then a change in soil isn't such a bad idea.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Thanks, Franka.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Everyone always says that you're the lady to talk to about this sort of thing. And they're right.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Wait, hold up, what exactly are they saying about me?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: They all told me that Franka's got a foul mouth, but she'll help you solve your troubles.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Which numbskulls are out there ruining my street cred?!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.text: Mamá, why are we... back in the room again?

attributes.content: Are you really interested in that equipment?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Then why didn't you just ask?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Right, I don't like it when you play with these parts, and I definitely don't want to see you end up like Grandma, holed up in the garage all day long.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: But you should've asked.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.text: I was worried you'd say no...

attributes.content: Right, I could say no, but maybe I wouldn't have. There could be a different outcome, another choice.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: But if you never try, you'll never have another choice.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: You see that table? That's your workbench from now on. Take out everything you've been hiding under your bed.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Now!
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Come in.
Boss.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Do you need me for something?
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: I'm sure you know that my last mission was in Davistown, right...?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I'm aware. What's up?
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: About that, I wrote up a mission report as per protocol.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Since when did we have a protocol like that?
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: Well, we do...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Mission report... Oh, now I remember. Yeah, I guess you're right.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: That was a big mission, with plenty of twists and turns. Good work getting a report out of all that.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: No, it’s nothing.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: So I trust this will fill in a lot of blanks about the incident.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: The man on the other side of the desk quickly reads through her report as she watches.
There's a sigh.
That's not what she expected.
This isn't what you should be writing reports on, Laura.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: We're in charge of technology. There shouldn't be anything in here unrelated to our engineering work.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: I understand that, but I saw so much more than that while carrying out my mission.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I can't pretend I didn't.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: Whatever. No one's going to read this anyway, so it'll do.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: He flips to the last page of the report and briskly signs his name.
You still have a long career ahead of you.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: You really need to learn to sort out what you've seen and what you haven't.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: Sorry, Chief, I'm just an engineer. I'm not too good at that sort of thing.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Which is why I have a request.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Go on.
attributes.name: Engineering Supervisor

attributes.content: I want to apply for the next round of exchange projects and be dispatched to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: *cough* Let's continue, then.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: W-Wait. I'm not ready yet. Let me get myself together first...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Okay, okay. Let's go.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Hm... So what's the story behind that puppet you carry on your waist?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: The puppet on my waist... What? Is that really an interview question?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Of course it. It's right here in the Big Book of Interview Questions Franka gave me. 'Every now and then, interviewees should be asked questions about the accessories they're wearing.'
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Alright then... My mother made me this, and I've been carrying it around ever since. Is that good enough?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Shorter than the expected answer length, but it shouldn't be a problem.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Besides, you've already been through so many terrifying tests before this.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Didn't Franka tell you? As long as you pass the tests, the interview's just a formality and an excuse to chat. The way I see it, there's nothing to prep for.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Oh, no no no. If I'm doing something, I've gotta do it right! I'm not taking any chances. Quick, next question!
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Ooh, this question seems pretty reliable...
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: Laura! Let's hang out!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Oh, are you studying for your Rhodes Island interview?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Looks like you've made up your mind.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: What'd you expect? Shh, we'll talk later. Let me finish this question first.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Laura, what are your thoughts on your future?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Clerk

attributes.content: My future?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: My... future...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.text: Mamá, do we really need to go?

attributes.content: It's too dangerous here, mija. We can't stay anymore. I don't want to see you grow up in a warzone.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: I don't want this either, but...
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: A lot of times, we don't get to decide our own fate. I... I don't have a choice.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.text: Choice... I don't get it. What's a choice...?
Please don't cry, Mamá... You still have me. I can make choices for you.

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Yes, mija. Yes, you're my choice.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Come, we'll go somewhere new, where you'll see a lot of new things, meet a lot of new people, and there will be a whole new fate waiting for you.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: One day, you'll find yourself between a rock and a hard place like this, and unsure of where the future will lead you.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: When that time comes, remember that as long as you keep moving forward, you'll find that your choice is there.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: And this time, you'll be brave enough to make it.
attributes.name: Mother
